facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 2458 of 1968

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 2458 of 1968.

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated June 29, 1969 of the Second Labour Court, West Bengal, Calcutta, in Case No. 229/33/67

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated June 29, 1969 of the Second Labour Court, West Bengal, Calcutta, in Case No. 229/33/67.

facts.text: Appellant filed application under s. 33(2)(b) of the Industrial Disputes Act 1947 seeking approval of order of removal from service against respondent

anchor.surface_text: filed by the appellant seeking approval of an order of removal from service passed against the respondent.

facts.text: Second Labour Court rejected the application under s. 33(2)(b)

anchor.surface_text: from an order of the Second Labour Court, West Bengal, rejecting an application under s. 33  2   b  of the Industrial Disputes Act 1947

facts.text: Respondent was an employee of the appellant

anchor.surface_text: The respondent was an employer, of the appellant.

facts.text: Respondent working as conductor

anchor.surface_text: who was working as companyductor on charges which it is number necessary to mention.

facts.text: Disciplinary proceedings taken against respondent on charges

anchor.surface_text: Certain disciplinary proceedings were taken against the respondent who was working as companyductor on charges

facts.text: Charges inquired into by Disciplinary Officer of the appellant

anchor.surface_text: These charges were inquired into by the Disciplinary Officer of the appellant.

facts.text: Disciplinary Officer found charges proved and submitted report to competent authority i.e. Special Officer Discipline

anchor.surface_text: That officer found the charges proved against the respondent and submitted his report to the companypetent authority i.e. Special Officer  Discipline .

facts.text: On May 18, 1967, competent authority after considering report of Inquiry Officer recorded order expressing agreement that respondent be removed from service after giving one month's wages

anchor.surface_text: On May 18, 1967 the companypetent authority, after companysidering the, report of the Inquiry Officer, recorded a numbere on the file expressing agreement wish the report of the, Inquiry Officer that the respondent be removed from service after giving him one months wages.

facts.text: Order stated: The delinquent is removed from the service of the Corporation. He will be given one months wages and simultaneously an application may be filed in the Tribunal seeking approval under Section 33(2) of the I.D. Act

anchor.surface_text: The last part of his order is reproduced below - The delinquent is removed from the service of the Corporation. He will be given one months wages and simultaneously an application may be filed in the Tribunal, seeking approval of the action taken, as required under Section 33 2  of the I.D. Act.

facts.text: Approval under s.33(2)(b) necessary because proceedings pending before 5th Industrial Tribunal, West Bengal on reference under s.10 of Act regarding disputes between appellant and its workmen

anchor.surface_text: It may be mentioned that such an approval was necessary because proceedings were pending before the 5th Industrial Tribunal, West Bengal, on account of a reference made under I 0 of the Act with regard to several disputes between the appellant and its workmen.

facts.text: Letter dated June 22, 1967 sent to respondent informing removal from service with effect from July 1, 1967

anchor.surface_text: A numbere dated June 22, 1967 was sent to the respondent in which he was informed that he was being removed from service with effect from July 1, 1967.

facts.text: Letter reached respondent on June 26, 1967

anchor.surface_text: This numbere reached him on June 26, 1967.

facts.text: One month's wages remitted to respondent on June 28, 1967 by Money Order

anchor.surface_text: One months wages were, remitted to him on June 28, 1967 by Money Order

facts.text: Respondent received one month's wages on July 1, 1967

anchor.surface_text: which he received on July 1, 1967.

facts.text: Application under s.33(2)(b) filed on July 3, 1967 which was a Monday

anchor.surface_text: An application under s. 33  2   b  of the Act was made on July 3, 1967 which was a Monday.

facts.text: Labour Court found report of domestic enquiry, findings therein, and punishment awarded justified, no interference called for

anchor.surface_text: The Labour Court, while finding that the report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified did number call for any interference.

facts.text: Labour Court held filing of application on July 3, 1967 did not satisfy proviso to s.33(2)(b)

anchor.surface_text: But it was of the view that the filing of the application under s. 33 2  b  of the Act on July 3, 1967 did number satisfy the requirements of the proviso thereto.

facts.text: Labour Court held passing of removal order on May 18, 1967, tendering wages, and filing application on July 3, 1967 did not constitute same transaction

anchor.surface_text: In other words the passing of the order of removal on May 18, 1967, the tendering of one months wages and the filing of the application before the Tribunal on July 3, 1967 did number companystitute part and parcel of the same transaction.

facts.text: Removal order recorded on official file on May 18, 1967 but effective only from July 1, 1967

anchor.surface_text: Firstly the order of removal was merely recorded on the official file on May 18,1967 and it was to be effective only from July 1, 1967.

facts.text: Before July 1, 1967 it was open to competent authority to withdraw the removal order

anchor.surface_text: Before that period it was open to the companypetent authority to withdraw the order.

facts.text: Date of dismissal of workman is July 1, 1967

anchor.surface_text: Therefore the  late of dismissal of the workman companyld only be July 1, 1967 and number any prior date on which the order was recorded on the file.

facts.text: July 1, 1967 was a Saturday

anchor.surface_text: The wages were also received by the workman i.e. the respondent on the same date which was a Saturday.

facts.text: No application could be filed on Sunday (July 2, 1967)

anchor.surface_text: It is obvious that numberapplication companyld have been filed on a Sunday which was a holiday.

concepts.interpretation: Requires prior approval from Labour Court/Tribunal for removal/dismissal of employee when industrial dispute is pending; proviso mandates that dismissal/discharge, payment of one month's wages, and filing of approval application occur simultaneously as part of same transaction.

issues.text: Whether the report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified and called for any interference

anchor.surface_text: The Labour Court, while finding that the report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified did number call for any interference.

issues.text: Whether the filing of the application under s. 33(2)(b) of the Act on July 3, 1967 satisfied the requirements of the proviso thereto and whether the order of removal, tendering of one month's wages and filing of the application constituted part and parcel of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: But it was of the view that the filing of the application under s. 33 2  b  of the Act on July 3, 1967 did number satisfy the requirements of the proviso thereto. In other words the passing of the order of removal on May 18, 1967, the tendering of one months wages and the filing of the application before the Tribunal on July 3, 1967 did number companystitute part and parcel of the same transaction.

arguments.claim: The report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified and did not call for any interference

anchor.surface_text: The Labour Court, while finding that the report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified did number call for any interference.

arguments.claim: The filing of the application under s. 33(2)(b) on July 3, 1967 did not satisfy the requirements of the proviso thereto because the passing of the order of removal on May 18, 1967, tendering of one month's wages, and filing of the application did not constitute part and parcel of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: But it was of the view that the filing of the application under s. 33 2  b  of the Act on July 3, 1967 did number satisfy the requirements of the proviso thereto. In other words the passing of the order of removal on May 18, 1967, the tendering of one months wages and the filing of the application before the Tribunal on July 3, 1967 did number companystitute part and parcel of the same transaction.

arguments.court_reasoning: Labour Court misunderstood facts and law; effective date of dismissal was July 1, wages received same day, application filed next working day after holiday

arguments.claim: The Labour Court wholly misunderstood the true position both on facts and in law

anchor.surface_text: It has been argued before us and rightly that the Labour Court wholly misunderstood the true position both on facts and in law.

court_response_anchor.surface_text: removal was merely recorded on the official file on May 18,1967 and it was to be effective only from July 1, 1967.

arguments.court_reasoning: Court agrees and proceeds to correct the misunderstanding

arguments.claim: The order of removal was merely recorded on the official file on May 18, 1967 and was to be effective only from July 1, 1967; before that it was open to the competent authority to withdraw the order

anchor.surface_text: Firstly the order of removal was merely recorded on the official file on May 18,1967 and it was to be effective only from July 1, 1967. Before that period it was open to the companypetent authority to withdraw the order.

arguments.claim: The date of dismissal of the workman could only be July 1, 1967 and not any prior date on which the order was recorded on the file

anchor.surface_text: Therefore the  late of dismissal of the workman companyld only be July 1, 1967 and number any prior date on which the order was recorded on the file.

arguments.claim: No application could have been filed on a Sunday which was a holiday

anchor.surface_text: It is obvious that numberapplication companyld have been filed on a Sunday which was a holiday.

arguments.claim: The proviso to s.33(2)(b) contemplates three things - (i) dismissal or discharge (ii) payment of wages and (iii) making of an application for approval - to be simultaneous and to be part of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: The proviso to s. 33 2  b  companytemplates three things  i  dismissal or discharge  ii  payment of wages and  iii  making of an application for approval to be simultaneous and to be part of the same transaction.

arguments.claim: The object of the proviso is that when the employer takes action under s.33(2)(b) by dismissing or discharging an employee he should immediately make payment to him or offer payment of wages for one month and also make an application for approval

anchor.surface_text: The object is that when the employer takes action under s. 33 2  b  by dismissing or discharging an employee he should immediately make payment to him or offer payment of wages for one month and also make an application to the Tribunal or the Labour Court, as the case may be, for approval.

arguments.claim: The employer's conduct should show that the three things contemplated under the proviso are parts of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: The employers companyduct should show that the three things companytemplated under the proviso are parts of the same transaction. See Strawboard Manufacturing Co. v. Govind 1 .

arguments.claim: In P. H. Kalyani v. M s. Air France, the order of dismissal was passed on May 28, 1960, communicated on May 30 with wages offered same time, application made same day, held to be in accordance with the proviso; does not mean all three things must be done on the same day

anchor.surface_text: In P. H. Kalyani v. M s. Air France, Calcutta  2  the order of dismissal was passed on May 28, 1960 and was companymunicated to the employee on May 30, 1960. The wages were offered to him at the same time when the order was companymunicated. An application was made under s. 3 3  2   b  on the same day. It was held that the application was in accordance with the proviso to s. 3 3  2  This decision shows that similar action has to be taken in these matters but that does number mean that all the three things mentioned before should be done on the same day.

arguments.claim: It is the conduct of the employer that has to be considered from the point of view of finding out whether the dismissal or discharge, payment of wages and making of the application for approval form part of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: It is the companyduct of the employer that has to be companysidered from the point of view of finding out whether the dismissal or discharge, payment of wages and making of the application for approval form a part of the same transaction.

holdings.text: The report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified and did not call for any interference

anchor.surface_text: The Labour Court, while finding that the report of the domestic enquiry and the finding therein as also the punishment awarded on the basis of that enquiry was justified did number call for any interference.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Labour Court determination accepted by Supreme Court without challenge or interference

holdings.text: The Labour Court wholly misunderstood the true position both on facts and in law

anchor.surface_text: It has been argued before us and rightly that the Labour Court wholly misunderstood the true position both on facts and in law.

holdings.text: The proviso to s. 33(2)(b) contemplates three things (i) dismissal or discharge (ii) payment of wages and (iii) making of an application for approval to be simultaneous and to be part of the same transaction

anchor.surface_text: The proviso to s. 33 2  b  companytemplates three things  i  dismissal or discharge  ii  payment of wages and  iii  making of an application for approval to be simultaneous and to be part of the same transaction.
